channel.title: Woodmont Industrial News Feed
channel.description: Daily industrial and CRE updates across key regions

item.title: Technology and the Future of the Creative Industry
item.description: Utopai Studios Co-Founder and CEO Cecilia Chen and ElevenLabs Co-Founder and CEO Mati Staniszewski discuss how AI and new technologies are transforming how stories are created and shared with Bloomberg's Ashish Verma at Bloomberg House in Davos on the sidelines of the 2026 World Economic Forum. (Source: Bloomberg)
item.category: PEOPLE NEWS — Personnel Moves in Industrial Brokerage/Development

item.title: Elliman’s Exclusive Group nabs Royal Palm’s managing partner
item.description: The longtime managing partner at one of Boca Raton’s top brokerages left the company to join Douglas Elliman’s Exclusive Group, The Real Deal has learned.  Kelly Brooks joined the Elliman team as a partner, according to a news release. The group is led by Nick Malinosky and Devin Kay, and is ranked Elliman’s top medium-sized team in Florida.  Brooks has been a licensed agent since 2006, state records show. Her license was moved to Douglas Elliman on Jan. 9.  Brooks was managing partner of Boca-based Royal Palm Properties, a firm led by David Roberts, the top-ranked real estate agent in […] This article originally appeared on The Real Deal. Click here to read the full story.
item.category: PEOPLE NEWS — Personnel Moves in Industrial Brokerage/Development
item.author: Katherine Kallergis

item.title: Movers & Shakers: Centennial Bank adds two lending VPs
item.description: In the latest roundup of South Florida real estate hiring news, firms sought to bolster their leadership in the region.  Centennial Bank hired two executives in South Florida to bulk up its lending capacity in the region, according to a news release. Frank de Ona and Sonia Suazo both join the bank as vice presidents focusing on commercial lending. De Ona was previously a vice president at Ocean Bank for more than six years. Suazo joins from TD, where she was a vice president in commercial lending for six years.  Douglas Elliman brought in Nir Perets to head sales at […] This article originally appeared on The Real Deal. Click here to read the full story.
item.category: PEOPLE NEWS — Personnel Moves in Industrial Brokerage/Development
item.author: Kate Hinsche

item.title: Sherrill taps Weiss to lead EDA, Potosnak as DEP commissioner
item.description: Gov.-elect Mikie Sherrill has filled two key posts impacting commercial real estate, naming Evan Weiss as CEO of the New Jersey Economic Development Authority while nominating Ed Potosnak as commissioner of the Department of Environmental Protection.
item.category: PEOPLE NEWS — Personnel Moves in Industrial Brokerage/Development
item.author: Joshua Burd

item.title: Camber, PGIM expand out of state with 745,000 sq. ft. industrial deal in Maryland
item.description: Camber Real Estate Partners and PGIM Real Estate have made a new acquisition outside New Jersey, adding more than 745,000 square feet of industrial space in the Baltimore region.
item.category: RELEVANT ARTICLES — Macro Trends & Industrial Real Estate News
item.author: Joshua Burd

item.title: CesiumAstro Expands Bee Cave, Texas, Headquarters-Manufacturing Operations
item.description: CesiumAstro, a company specializing in connectivity solutions, plans to establish operations in Bee Cave, Texas. The more than $500 million project is expected to create more than 500 jobs over the next five years.
item.category: RELEVANT ARTICLES — Macro Trends & Industrial Real Estate News

item.title: L Catterton boss sells Palm Beach home for $58M
item.description: Michael Chu sold the home he his wife built in Palm Beach 10 years ago for $58.3 million.  He and his wife Elizabeth Chu sold that house in an off-market deal that recorded this week. Records show they sold the oceanfront house at 102 Angler Avenue to a trust named for the address and managed by attorney Sarah T. Connolly. Michael Chu is the executive chairman and co-founder of L Catterton, the largest consumer-focused private equity firm in the world, according to its website. It has $37 billion in assets under management.  The Chus acquired the 0.60-acre property for $1 […] This article originally appeared on The Real Deal. Click here to read the full story.
item.category: PEOPLE NEWS — Personnel Moves in Industrial Brokerage/Development
item.author: Kate Hinsche

item.title: Union Pacific CEO tells customers they will benefit from merger
item.description: Union Pacific's chief executive fired back at rivals who oppose the merger to create the first transcontinental railroad. The post Union Pacific CEO tells customers they will benefit from merger appeared first on FreightWaves .
item.category: PEOPLE NEWS — Personnel Moves in Industrial Brokerage/Development
item.author: Trains.com Staff

item.title: Solstice Advanced Materials Expands Chesterfield County, Virginia, Manufacturing Operations
item.description: Solstice Advanced Materials Inc., a specialty chemicals and materials company, plans to expand operations in Chesterfield County, Virginia. The $220 million project is expected to create 100 jobs.

item.title: Sitex adds 26,000 sq. ft. Monroe warehouse as latest acquisition in Central Jersey
item.description: Sitex Group has acquired a 26,000-square-foot warehouse in Monroe, adding to its portfolio in the well-known Exit 8A submarket along the New Jersey Turnpike.
